result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph-Jamal R. Brantley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Glinski.  Victim statements made by -- mother & sister of deceased.  Statements made by deft's mother, father, & sister.  Sentencing arguments made.   

Ct 1 - deft sentenced to 35yrs WSP; initial confinement of 20yrs followed by 15yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 377 days.  If any add'l credit is requested, defense counsel to submit request to DA.  If agreed upon, the parties may submit a stip to the court.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $12,514.62; jointly & severally w/Brandon H & Markece T.

Ct 3 - deft sentenced to 5yrs WSP consec to count 1; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 2yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.    

Ct 2 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 10yrs consec to counts 1 & 3.  Probation conditions identical to those of ES.

Ct 4 - sentence w/held; placed om probation for 1yr consec to counts 1 & 3.  Probation conditions identical to those of ES.

Deft adjudged guilty on all four counts.  Sentencing set for 5/4/15 @ 3pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Atty Terry Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced for today's hrg.  Atty Matt Knight appeared from the City Atty's office.  Atty Rose requests the Fire & Police Commission's file on Kyle Baars as well as the investigative report of Lt. Hetland.  Arguments heard.  Court finds there is no legal authority from this court to order the Police & Fire Commission to release their file.  With respect to the PD's file - there is no authority for the court to order public release of internal file especially while there is a ongoing criminal investigation.

Note from jury

Minutes:  Day 6.  Same appearances as before.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Defense case continues.  Testimony taken from Kyle B.  Defense rests @ 9:37am.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Jury instruction conference held.  Closing arguments heard.  Jurors excused from the courtroom.  Lunch brought in for the jurors.  Court will excuse Juror Nicole V. on request of defense.  Alternate juror - Charles W.  Alternate jurors Charles W & Nicole V reconvene into the courtroom @ 1:33pm; excused by the Court @ 1:35pm.  Remaining 12 jurors summoned into courtroom for final instructions.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 1:41pm.  Verdict reached @ 3:12pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 3:38pm in the courtroom.  Deft found guilty on all four counts.  Jury polled.  State moves to revoke bond - motion denied.  Bond to continue.  State moves for judgment on the verdict; court w/holds a ruling at this time.  Defense renews motion to dismiss; defense to reduce this motion to writing with supporting brief - to be filed w/in 25 days.  State may respond 20 days thereafter.  MH set for 4/27/15 @ 2:30pm.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2:30pm in the event the motion is denied.  Clerk Lema returns exhibits #23 & #24 (gun & boot w/THC) to Det. Hagen's designee.
Email to Judge Schroeder from Robert Zapf dated 03/01/15.
Email to Judge Schroeder from Christoper Glinski dated 03/01/15.
to Lewis Lindquist 240
#A - letter from DA Zapf to Atty Glinski re: add'l discovery

Minutes:  Day 5.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Matter taken up in chambers with attys & deft regarding evidence in the case.  Parties reconvene in the courtroom - deft elects not to testify.  Jury instruction conference held.  Atty Glinski reports he will not be calling Barry T.  Jurors reconvene @ 10:18am in the courtroom.  Testimony continues - P.O. Adam Jurgens (re-called).  Court takes a recess.  Court reconvenes @ 11:02am.  Due to the issue raised this morning, the trial is adjourned for the day.  Trial to resume @ 9am on 3/2/15.  Jurors released @ 11:04am; instructed to return @ 9am on 3/2/15.  Attys instructed to return @ 12:30pm today. Add'l discussion held on jury instructions.

Minutes:  Day 4.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:37am.  Testimony continues - Brandon H.  Jurors released for lunch @ 11:53am; instructed to return @ 1pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:15pm.  Testimony continues - Michael R., P.O. Brandie Pie, Markese T.  State offers their exhibits which have been used in testimony.  State rests @ 4:10pm.   continuing with Clerk J.Thwing.  Defense witnesses:  Det.Dan Bandi, P.O. Adam Jurgens, P.O. Leo Viola, Det. Jason Kenesie.   Court adjourns trial at 451pm and instructed to return on at 8:45am on 02-27-15.  Discussion ensues on possible witness for DE and instructions to DE on testimony. Parties dismissed at 5:04pm.
Regarding Agreed Facts

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/K.Zirbel and T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Court reconvenes in the courtroom at 9:12 a.m.  Testimony continues - Dr. Agnieszka Rogalska, Lt. Randy Oberst, & P.O. Albert Gonzales.  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:48pm; instructed to return @ 1:15pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:36pm.  Testimony continues - P.O. Todd Thorne, Mark Simonson (Crime Lab examiner), Ms. Sharon Polakowski (DNA Crime Lab examiner), Laura L, & Colton Proft.  Jurors excused for the day @ 4:50pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/26/15.
PRELIMINARY
from DA Zapf re: potential other acts evidence

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Juror Vargas questioned outside presence of jury re: she recognized someone in the hallway associated with this case.  Defense moves to strike the juror.  Court denies the motion at this time with leave to revisit this issue prior to the jury commencing deliberations.  Defense moves to limit the State from using all the photos of the crime scene; motion denied by the Court.  Jurors reconvene in the courtroom @ 9:34am.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Opening statements.  Testimony commences - Jacob L.  Jurors released @ noon; instructed to return @ 1pm.  Due to other cases on the calendar, jurors reconvene @ 1:43pm.  Testimony continues - P.O. Skowronski, John D., P.O. Dan Weyrauch, Det. Eric Traxler, & P.O. Mohit Singh (take out of order).  Jurors released @ 4:43pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/25/15.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Glinski.  Case ready to proceed.  Arguments heard on motions in limine; w/held in part & attys stipulate in part, granted in part.  Voir dire commences @ 9:44am.  Jury is selected @ 11:55am.  Unselected jurors are released for the day @ 11:57am.  Selected jurors are released for the day @ 12:10pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/24/15.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Glinski.  Atty Glinski has been appointed.  FPT 2/13/15 @ 10am, JS 2/23/15 @ 9am
Atty:  C Glinski.

Defendant Joseph-Jamal R. Brantley appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: The Court strikes information from criminal complaint related to race without objection. Atty Henry moves to withdraw; DE requesting new counsel, states his family is searching for private counsel; discussion held; The Court grants Atty Henry's motion to withdraw, PD's office to appoint new counsel. 11-17-14 Jury Trial removed from The Court's calendar.  Status conference scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Matthew Hagen sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by co-defendant's counsel, Atty. Rose. Cross-examination by Atty. Aileen Henry. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-14-14 @ 8:15am with co-defs. Information filed. Bond continued.
Atty  A Henry.
